title: How to Text an Older Guy: 9 Expert Tips to Impress & Interest Him

steps.title: You don't have to change yourself to make an older guy like you.
steps.content: You don't have to change yourself to make an older guy like you. Be open about who you are. Tell him what you like to do for fun, let your sense of humor shine, and try to relax. It may be tempting to hide your interests or change how you communicate for an older man, but it's not a good idea in the long run. Be yourself so that he likes you for you. [1] X Research source If you're going to a club with your friends, don't hide it because you think it makes you sound less mature. Say something like, "I've been dancing with my friends tonight. Do you like dancing?" It's best just to be upfront and honest. [2] X Research source If you feel like you have to change yourself to keep his attention, he may not be a good match for you. The person you like should make you feel more comfortable being yourself, not the other way around. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Be confident in your success.
steps.content: Be confident in your success. An older guy is likely to be more secure in his accomplishments, so he'll be impressed by yours. If your artwork was published in a magazine recently or you just got a job promotion, text him about it. Be open about your goals, and don't be shy in revealing how you plan to reach them. [4] X Research source If he asks what you're up to at work, be open about the specifics. Text him something like, "I've been organizing an event the past few weeks. I'm responsible for hiring the caterers and booking the musical guests!"

steps.title: Show off your intelligence and maturity by discussing current events.
steps.content: Show off your intelligence and maturity by discussing current events. If there's a lull in the text conversation, bring up what's happening in the news. Share your opinion about current issues in politics and pop culture, and text him questions about his point of view. Though your opinions and even the way you consume news may be different due to your age difference, approach the conversation like equals. [5] X Research source If you're unsure about how to bring up the subject, reference an article you recently read or a book that helped you learn about the subject. Just because he's older doesn't mean he knows more about current events than you. Try not to be intimidated, and don't let him talk down to you. A relationship has got to be founded upon mutual respect, no matter the age difference.

steps.title: An older guy has a world of life experiences.
steps.content: An older guy has a world of life experiences. Take an interest in his life by asking him questions. Maybe he traveled the world for a few years before settling down in the city you both live in. Ask him about his favorite place to visit or his favorite travel story. Text him questions about his career and hobbies, too. You might even learn some new things from his varied experiences. Just make sure he's open to learning from you, too. [6] X Research source Maybe he lived in New York City for a few years in his twenties. Ask him something like, "What was it like living in New York City? Do you ever miss it?" If he's been painting in his spare time for ten years, text him, "What's your favorite medium to paint with? Has it changed over the years?"

steps.title: An older dude can still have a great sense of humor.
steps.content: An older dude can still have a great sense of humor. A fun way to break the ice and even flirt a little is to show off your comedic chops. [7] X Research source Send a funny YouTube video that made you think of him or even a GIF from a TV show you both like. Laughing together (even over text) is a great way to establish common ground with an older guy. It's also a great opportunity to show off your wit. [8] X Research source Maybe you're both huge fans of the show The Office. Send him a clip of your favorite scene with the caption, "Can't stop laughing at this."

steps.title: Use emojis to flirt and show off your personality.
steps.content: Use emojis to flirt and show off your personality. If you're joking around or using sarcasm, throw in a smiley face to make sure he knows you're just kidding around. Add a red heart or a heart eyes emoji when you send something flirty. [9] X Research source Don't use them in every text you send, though. An older guy probably won't use as many emojis, and he may be overwhelmed or turned off by too many heart eyes and smiley faces. [10] X Research source Don't worry if your older guy never uses emojis. Different generations use texting in different ways. Sometimes, that results in older guys using fewer emojis (or none at all).

steps.title: Don't drop everything for an older guy.
steps.content: Don't drop everything for an older guy. This can come off as a little clingy. Instead, fill up your time with your hobbies and passions so that you only text him when you've got something new and interesting to say. Hang out with your friends, go on interesting day trips, and stay focused on your hobbies like hiking and playing music. [11] X Trustworthy Source HelpGuide Nonprofit organization dedicated to providing free, evidence-based mental health and wellness resources. Go to source Older guys are more likely to be attracted to strong, independent people. [12] X Research source It can be tempting to neglect your hobbies and responsibilities when you really like someone, especially a successful older guy. Stay focused on yourself so that you remember how awesome and successful you are on your own.

steps.title: An older guy may not want to text all the time.
steps.content: An older guy may not want to text all the time. Different generations use texting a little differently and may not be as up for hours of chatting and banter. Use texting to catch up and make plans, but rely on in-person conversations to really get to know each other. Don't fret about response times, either. Text in moderation (1 text a day or a few throughout the week) and prioritize your time together off the phone. [13] X Research source Avoid double-texting when you haven't heard from him in a few hours. He may be at work or busy with other plans.

steps.title: Make sure the dynamic between you is equal.
steps.content: Make sure the dynamic between you is equal. It's unfortunate, but some older guys may be interested in a younger person for the wrong reasons. If they frequently talk down to you when you text or pressure you to send explicit texts, those are red flags. Don't give away too many personal details about your life when you first start texting. Avoid sexting or sharing an intimate photo of yourself with someone you don't completely trust or know well. Trust your intuition and wait until you really feel comfortable around him to share more personal things. Walk away if they seem controlling, manipulative, or condescending. You deserve to be treated like an equal.
